column99: Education Officer to the Neuroscience Academy Denmark (NAD)
column100: A position as Education Officer is available at the Neuroscience Academy Denmark (NAD). The academy is the collaboration between the four health faculties at University of Copenhagen, Aarhus University, University of Southern Denmark and Aalborg University.  The NAD Office is hosted at the Department of Neuroscience, The Faculty of Health and Medical Sciences University of Copenhagen.     Job description  The Education Officer will be employed at NAD Office with reference to the executive director. You will have responsibility for the development and continuous improvement of the NAD prePhD year program. The primary focus of the role is to create the educational programme in neuroscience taking into account the current years Research Columns and the qualifications of the NAD PhD candidates.     Tasks include     Maintain the NAD portfolio of educational activities   Follow-up and/or take initiatives to new PhD courses to provide PhD students enrolled inneuroscience at one of the participating Faculties with the best options for research training and education.   Practical and administrative support of PhD courses and workshops   Administrative support to the NAD Education and Training Committee   Evaluation of teaching activities   Collaboration with the PhD schools     About you     You have a master's degree in biomedical sciences with a clear course curriculum in neuroscience and neuro-related subjects.   You have experience within university education, development of course curricula, and course administration. In addition, experience with new teaching principles and implementation such as principles in higher education is an advantage.   Fluency in English   Fluency in Danish will be an advantage.     We offer     A unique opportunity to be part of shaping the training and education of tomorrows researcher in neuroscience   An attractive and and interesting workplace in constant development   A versatile and exciting job with many challenges and big influence on how the job is organised   A workplace with focus on an excellent work-life balance     For questions please contact Nicolas Caesar Petersen at  nicolascp@sund.ku.dk .    Terms of employment  The position is full-time fixed-term for three years. Starting date is as soon as possible. Salary, pension and terms of employment will be in accordance with the agreement between the Danish Ministry of Finance and AC (the Danish Confederation of Professional Associations) as an academic employee or special consultant depending on your qualifications. Depending on qualifications, a supplement may be negotiated.   Deadline for applying is May 15, 2022.    Interviews will be held on an ongoing basis.
